intro: Cheiranthus flexuosus, commonly known as the flexible wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal and stem leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are bright yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Cheiranthus flexuosus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
